sections.title: Why Tuning is Important
sections.content: Tuning Road Runner is essential for achieving accurate and reliable robot movement. Without proper tuning, your robot may not follow paths correctly, leading to inconsistent autonomous performance.

sections.title: Step-by-Step Tuning Process
content: Set up the tuning op modes provided in the quickstart project.
Run drive characterization to determine your robot's feedforward parameters.
Adjust the PID coefficients for your drive to minimize error.
Test your robot's movement and iterate on the parameters as needed.
Repeat the process if you make significant changes to your robot (e.g., weight, motors, wheels).

sections.title: Special Considerations
sections.content: Some tuning steps vary depending on your robot's drive type (e.g., mecanum, tank) or localization method (drive encoders vs. dead wheels). Always follow the instructions specific to your setup.

sections.title: Troubleshooting Common Issues
content: Robot doesn't follow the path accurately: Revisit your tuning parameters, especially PID and feedforward values.
Robot drifts or veers off course: Check for mechanical issues and ensure your localization method is set up correctly.
Performance changes with battery voltage: Make sure your feedforward parameters are tuned for your typical battery voltage.

sections.title: Reference
sections.content: For a detailed guide, see the Road Runner Tuning Guide.
